turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: This administration does not negotiate with terrorists.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Pity. Mr. Gibbs.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Stop.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: You'll do it?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Yes, I'll do it.  Just leave my family alone.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: Good. Good.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Someday, you'll regret my nature.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: You don't like seeing people get hurt. Now in morality, that is a virtue. In politics, however, that is weakness.  You were a hostage to everyone else *                    long before you were a hostage to

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: The taste of defeat is bitter, no?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: One thing I've learned as

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: There goes your ride.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Let my daughter go or I'll take you out!

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: If you put down the gun, I promise not to drop her on the way down.

turns.speaker: KORSHUNOV
turns.text: No you won't. You'll compromise... like always.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Hold on, Alice.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Our only policy assumes the plane is on the ground. Our hands are completely tied while they're in the air.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: Okay, Gentlemen, we'll take no action until we confirm that the president is off the plane... Lee, go huddle with the D.O.D. I want an options paper on this in 20 minutes.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Twenty minutes?

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: You heard me.  You. Congress and cabinet heads.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Madame Vice president. We have an options paper.  chandler takes the options paper, waves off Lee, and reads it as she talks.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: Yes. You've made yourself quite clear.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Finally, we can bargain.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: I'm sure we can strike some sort of arrangement. Land the plane and we'll trade you hostages for fuel.

turns.speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
turns.text: Our KH-ll's took this one at 0100 hours. What you see here is the mobilization of two mechanized brigades.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: They've gotta be joking.

turns.speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
turns.text: The northern border's gotten a bit hairy. Their MiGs are playing tag with our Tomcats and our boys are just itching to engage.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Tell our boys to cool their jets. I don't need `em creating policy for me.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Mr. Caidwell, the ground's a few miles away. How do you propose getting us from here to there?

turns.speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
turns.text: Gravity.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: We've already played our cards, Major. There's no turning back.

turns.speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
turns.text: We can't jump from here or at this speed. But if we could get a message out - tell the refueling plane...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: They've cut communication, and I spent a good bit of time looking for alternatives. My only solution ran out of batteries.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Get `em ready.  You... come with me.

turns.speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
turns.text: Eighteen thousand feet, sir. And two hundred knots... otherwise it's suicide.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I'll not going without my family.

turns.speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: MAJOR CALDWELL
turns.text: Sir, we stay with the President.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: That isn't necessary.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: May I speak to you for a moment?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Can't it wait?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No, Mr. President.  It can't.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Don't.  I know spin control when I feel it.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Rose, I don't have time for this.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: For godsakes, Jim, slow down and stop acting like the little dutch boy.  Not even you can plug all the world's leaks.  Don't you think it's a sign you're pushing too hard when your daughter sees more of you on MTV news than in person.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: She's a big girl.  She understands.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: How do you know she understands? You haven't spent more than five minutes with her, or me, in weeks.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: And when have I had five minutes? When I wake up in the morning and I'm already three hours behind Schedule.  What do you want me to do, Rose, tell the G7 to fuck off because I'm a family man?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You know what?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I miss you. And I miss her.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: But that's the point, Jim. We're right here.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I wish it were that easy...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I'll make it up to you, I promise.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I should trust that promise? Because you know the voters are still waiting for that middle class tax cut.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: This promise isn't subject to Congressional approval.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: How did your speech go?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Well, they aren't burning me in effigy. That's always a good sign.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Look on the bright side, hon. Shep here thinks I'll be a one termer.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Shall I ask the Chief of Staff to schedule your daughter in?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I don't know why you stayed.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Please... don't start with me.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Call Petrov...  I'll be back.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Both of you.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Flying the plane.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You haven't even driven a car since you took office.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: The fax machines.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: The fax machines.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: No good. I said they disabled the communications system.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: No. I thought about this, Mr.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Where are we sending it?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: White House Situation room.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Someone should give you a raise.

turns.speaker: SECRETARY
turns.text: Actually, sir, you could be that someone.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Did they say anything about my family?

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: They're still alive, but the loyalists plan to start killing hostages in forty minutes.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Then tell me there's a rescue operation underway.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: and if that means negotiating...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You know my policy. We don't negotiate with terrorists. If we start now, all of America becomes a target.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: But this is different, sir. You're the President.

turns.speaker: V.P. CHANDLER
turns.text: Please, Mr. President. You're going to get yourself killed. Is that your solution?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Freeing Stravanavitch is gonna get tens of thousands killed. I can't live with that.  I'm not royalty. I'm an elected official and the integrity of the office of the President is infinitely more important than the man who holds that office.  We don't negotitate. Not as long as I'm President. Is that understood?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
turns.text: We're under attack.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Where's my family?

turns.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
turns.text: We're handling it, sir.

turns.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
turns.text: One.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: SECRET SERVICE AGENT
turns.text: Two... THREE. GO!

turns.speaker: SWITCHBOARD
turns.text: White House switchboard. How may I direct your call.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Okay listen, listen carefully. This is an emergency call from Air Force One. Who's there? Is the Vice- President there?

turns.speaker: SWITCHBOARD
turns.text: who can I say is calling?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: This is the President.

turns.speaker: SWITCHBOARD
turns.text: Yeah, right.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Don't cut me off. This is an emergency.

turns.speaker: SWITCHBOARD
turns.text: Sir, the President does not call this particular number. So whoever you are get a life, before I have this call traced.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: You don't understand. This is an emergency. Let me talk to anyone.

turns.speaker: SWITCHBOARD
turns.text: Okay... if you're the President, when's your wife's birthday?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Look lady, I don't have time for games. Just put the....

turns.speaker: SWITCHBOARD
turns.text: Thank you for calling the white House...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: No. no. no. Wait. Wait.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: *                     CBS said they'll give us four minutes.  They thought the Russian was a nice touch.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I always wondered if my freshman Russian class would come in handy.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: You wanna knock of f?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: No, no.  I'm fine.  What did the Speaker say?

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: He and the NRA don't like the wording.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: With all due respect, sir, maybe you should give them this one.  Your numbers are still pretty low and you called in a lot of chips to nail Stravanavitch.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I might still have a few chips left.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: *                     We could always put you in a duck blind with a twelve gauge.  The second amendment types'll love that.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: This is a crime bill, Shep.  Killing a couple ducks won't get it through committee.  Besides, Shep, I told you...  I don't shoot babies and I don't kiss guns.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: Other way around, sir.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Right... Christ I'm tired.  Do me a favor and keep me away from the press.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: It's bait.  Don't take it.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: Sir, the Speaker of the House attacked this administration on national television.  You can't afford to leave that hanging.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Did we tape the Duke game?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I said it's not worth the fight.  Steward, please.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: We'll just say it was in bad taste.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: You give me ulcers.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: That's my job.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Defense and State Department in the conference room in one hour.  I want to review the Iraq situation.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: Mr. President... they're ready for you in the conference room.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Okay.  Hey, pumpkin, you'll tell me all about it later, right?

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: Mr. President, how the hell did you get on board?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: I never left. Where's my wife and daughter?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Shepherd.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: Sir...

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: My god. I think that was a MiG.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: A MiG? Where the hell are we?

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: Iraq, sir. We're over Iraq.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Iraq? Shep, you're fired.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: How long's it been since you flew, sir?

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: Twenty-five years.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: Twenty five minutes. They should be here any moment.

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: They better. Fuel's almost gone.

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: IT'S OPEN!

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: DO YOU SEE TEEM?

turns.speaker: SHEPHERD
turns.text: WE'RE HOOKED!

turns.speaker: MARSHALL
turns.text: We're hooked. Hove into position.

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: Commissioner, we both know the Mercury shuttle needs another month of pre-launch testing.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: Forget it.  The boys on the board want that shuttle to go on schedule.

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: And what do the boys on the board know about safety, Commissioner?  Let <u>me</u> talk to them.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: Bud, get wise to the political realities. The boys on the board are under a lot of pressure from the boys downtown.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: You handle your front office people, I'll handle the press and leave the boys in Washington to the boys downtown and the boys downtown to the boys on the board.

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: Commissioner.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: I just wish it was that simple.

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: That's right, Commissioner.  Senselessly murdered just minutes ago.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: That just doesn't make any sense.

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: I wonder how your boys in Washington are going to take this one.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: I told you, leave the boys in Washington to the boys downtown and the boys down...

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: You've made your point, Commissioner. There's only one other pilot who can handle that shuttle and that's Clarence Oveur.  He's got a lunar flight today.  I want him pulled.  Jacobs, pull Oveur!

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: Forget it.  I was reading.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: I was reading too.

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: What's the story?

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: Some southern plantation owner falls in love with this poor...

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: I was asking McCrosky, Commissioner.

turns.speaker: KRUGER
turns.text: Kruger, Sagittarius.

turns.speaker: COMMISSIONER
turns.text: Commissioner, Aquarius.

turns.speaker: DUNN
turns.text: Did you feel that?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yes I did...

turns.speaker: DUNN
turns.text: Felt like a large asteroid.

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Yes it did.  Mr. Dunn, can I ask you a personal question?

turns.speaker: DUNN
turns.text: What is it, Mary?

turns.speaker: MARY
turns.text: Um...  Do you people scream right when you... you know.

turns.speaker: DUNN
turns.text: Oveur.

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: Dunn.

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: Shut down accelerators.

turns.speaker: DUNN
turns.text: Accelerators down.

turns.speaker: DUNN
turns.text: We seem to have a malfunction in disposal unit four, sir.

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: You better check it, Unger.

turns.speaker: DUNN
turns.text: Sir, I've got an overload in disposal unit four.

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: You better check on it, Mr. Dunn.  I'll stay here and fly the ship.

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: Dunn.

turns.speaker: DUNN
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: OVEUR
turns.text: You better take this.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: That's not important now, Elaine.  We have to talk.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: It's got to be stopped!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: But, Ted, the invitations have already gone out.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I mean the Mercury flight.  It's not safe and, Kurtz, you know why.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, what's wrong?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Ask Simon.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, you're overworked.  You've been flying yourself into the ground.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: There's nothing wrong with me!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Let's relax tonight, just the two of us. I'll make a quiet Italian dinner just the way you like it, with spaghetti.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: You're as bad as the rest of them, Elaine!  It's all here in the design specifications!  Look!  It's all here!

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, please.  You're just making things difficult for yourself.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine, what happened to us?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, I loved you and I'll always love you. But I need Simon.  He's stable.  He's a good provider.  I want that at this stage of the game, Ted.  He might have his faults, but Simon doesn't know the meaning of the word fear and I need that in a man.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Eat this spaghetti, Ted.  It'll make you feel a lot better.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Who's that, Ted?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Sammy Davis Junior.  Terrible car accident.  He hasn't been the same since.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine, when are you going to realize Simon Kurtz put me in here to get me out of the way.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: And when are you going to realize, Ted, that your mental hygiene is the most important thing right now.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: His name's David Stockman.  He's been here twenty years, that's all he says.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, you must remember what the doctor said, the first step on the road to sanity is admitting that you're sick.  Now take your electro-shock and you'll be back at the space center in no time.  And by the way, Ted, I'm leaving you for Simon.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: No goodbyes, Elaine.  Just go.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: If that's the way you want it.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: That's the way I want it.  Just turn the radio on and go.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Goodbye, Ted.  I don't want to hurt you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted!  What are you...?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I have to get in there.  I have to stop this flight.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, we're taking off!

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Let me by, Elaine.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: What are you doing, Ted?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I've got it, Elaine!  I've figured out what's wrong with the shuttle!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Not now, Elaine!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted!

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted.  I don't know why you got on this flight.  I don't know what you're trying to prove.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine, we have to go back.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: We can't go back.  We had something very special, but it's all over.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine, I mean the mission has to be aborted.  This ship should never have passed FSA inspection.  This thing is held together by string and chewing gum.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, get a grip on yourself.  You should never have left the hospital.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Then you <u>do</u> think I'm insane.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I've never used the word insane, Ted.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What word would you use, Elaine?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: The word is sick.  Ted -- very, very, very sick.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: What would you say if I told you the toilet just blew up in my face.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'd use the word insane.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: There's something dangerously wrong with this ship, Elaine.  I know its the wiring. That toilet's just the tip of the iceberg.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, a toilet's not going to kill anyone.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted!

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine, what's going on?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, there's no time to explain.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Elaine, I'm going back there.  Just hold onto that stick and try to control this hunk of tin as best you can.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, please be careful.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, we've only got ten minutes.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Not now, Elaine.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I mean until we start to burn up.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Kurtz was the one who got us into this mess in the first place.  You people knew this ship wasn't ready to fly.  You played God with over a hundred lives, Kruger, and for what -- the prestige of your precious space program.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: That was very well put, Ted.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Well, Elaine, this might be it if those guys on the ground don't think of something.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I just want you to know, I love you Ted and always will.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: That might be the news we've been waiting for.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Simon just ejected!

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Sit down, Elaine.  If this bomb trick works we just might make it.  Simon was a fool to eject now.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You mean...

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: That's right -- premature ejection.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: What will happen to him, Ted?

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: The sun will heat that thing to over 450 degrees within seconds.  He'll roast like a pig on a spit.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Are you afraid?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Not when I'm with you, Ted.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: I guess you'd have to be a fool not to be afraid at a time like this.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: We've blown the computer!  Elaine!  Set course change!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Set!

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Now!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Compute!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted, the lever!

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: Kramer, the WORP control handle just came off in my hand.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ted seemed to get worse after I told him about Simon, Doctor.

turns.speaker: RUMACK
turns.text: The human brain is a highly complex organ, Elaine, perhaps the most complex next to the bladder.  Let me show you.  Ted's problem is in this area.  This area, this area, here, here, here, under here, here...

turns.speaker: RUMACK
turns.text: So you see, our task isn't made any easier by Ted's refusal to admit that he's sick.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: What can <u>I</u> do, Doctor Rumack?

turns.speaker: RUMACK
turns.text: You can eat balanced meals, exercise, and take Geritol.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I mean for Ted.

turns.speaker: RUMACK
turns.text: You can be gentle with him, Elaine.  He's been working out a lot of his aggressions here in the garden.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Is that a good sign, Doctor?

turns.speaker: RUMACK
turns.text: The brain is an amazingly complex organ, Elaine.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Is he making any progress, Doctor?

turns.speaker: RUMACK
turns.text: Yes -- last week that pile of mud was only this high.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: For the best little computer officer on the Mercury mission.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Simon.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Who would believe that Elaine Thompson was once a stewardess on the Denver-Chicago run.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: And I can hardly believe that I'm engaged to someone like you, Simon.  I'm a very lucky woman.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Women <u>and</u> the space program have come a long way, sweetheart.  But after the wedding, no more complicated computers for my little girl.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: But, darling, they've offered me a chance to head up the computer analysis division for the Jupiter probe.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: You're heading up the division in charge of babies for Mr. and Mrs. Simon Kurtz.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Frank's the best pilot in the program.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'm so excited, Simon.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I guess this is a first for you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: No, I've been excited before.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Elaine!  Ted's a danger to himself, he's a threat to this mission and his behavior does absolutely nothing to promote peace in the Middle East.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Simon, why has he become so... so...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: So mentally ill?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Meet me onboard, sweetheart.  I have to pick up a few things at the drugstore.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Don't be too long.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Have you got it straightened out now?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: That's my girl.
